body_html:
The default graph is a property of the current thread. tf.reset_default_graph() function applies only to the current thread. Calling this function while a tf.Session or tf.InteractiveSession is active will result in undefined behavior. Using any previously created tf.Operation or tf.Tensor objects after calling this function will result in undefined behavior.

import tensorflow as tf
g = tf.Graph()
with g.as_default():
  a = tf.constant(1.0)
  b = tf.constant(1.0)
  c = a + b
body_text:
The default graph is a property of the current thread. tf.reset_default_graph() function applies only to the current thread. Calling this function while a tf.Session or tf.InteractiveSession is active will result in undefined behavior. Using any previously created tf.Operation or tf.Tensor objects after calling this function will result in undefined behavior.
import tensorflow as tf
g = tf.Graph()
with g.as_default():
  a = tf.constant(1.0)
  b = tf.constant(1.0)
  c = a + b
body:
The default graph is a property of the current thread. `tf.reset_default_graph()` function applies only to the current thread. Calling this function while a tf.Session or tf.InteractiveSession is active will result in undefined behavior. Using any previously created tf.Operation or tf.Tensor objects after calling this function will result in undefined behavior.

```
import tensorflow as tf
g = tf.Graph()
with g.as_default():
  a = tf.constant(1.0)
  b = tf.constant(1.0)
  c = a + b
```
